positions.subtitle: LimeTray
positions.description: Helped organization to build multiple products and moving from the monolithic architecture to microservices by ensuring DRY/High cohesion low coupling principles. Played every role from being a developer to a manager to a support guy whatever came in the way. Proposed and developed following frameworks/libraries-: 1. User Manager: It handles all the internal/external users and customers including their authorization and authentication across all the services and products. 2. Lt-Utils: Microservice utility framework built on top of Spring boot which doubled the productivity of developers and reduced the code of services up to 50% allowing the developer to concentrate on main business logic. (It had authorization, logger, request and user tracking. other utilities) 3. Lt-models: A library which centrally holds all the DTOs being used across the services and ensures DRY, code reusability principles. 4. Managed and developed many other services/products. 5. Technology Stack: Java, Python, MySQL, Cassandra, Spring boot, Kafka, Docker, Kubernetes, ActiveMQ.
positions.title: Senior Software Engineer
positions.description_html:
Helped organization to build multiple products and moving from the monolithic architecture to microservices by ensuring DRY/High cohesion low coupling principles.
Played every role from being a developer to a manager to a support guy whatever came in the way.

Proposed and developed following frameworks/libraries-:

1. User Manager: It handles all the internal/external users and customers including their authorization and authentication across all the services and products.

2. Lt-Utils: Microservice utility framework built on top of Spring boot which doubled the productivity of developers and reduced the code of services up to 50% allowing the developer to concentrate on main business logic. (It had authorization, logger, request and user tracking. other utilities)

3. Lt-models: A library which centrally holds all the DTOs being used across the services and ensures DRY, code reusability principles.

4. Managed and developed many other services/products.

5. Technology Stack: Java, Python, MySQL, Cassandra, Spring boot, Kafka, Docker, Kubernetes, ActiveMQ.

positions.subtitle: LimeTray
positions.description: Managed and built multiple products, few of them are: 1. POS(Point of Sale System): Built an enterprise software to take and manage orders. Optimized it to handle 2000 orders at a time by memory optimization and JVM profiling. 2. Back Office: It can be integrated with any POS or order online system and helped the restaurant in managing their recipe and inventory real-time.

We are a leading Non-banking finance company (NBFC) engaged in business of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprise (MSME) loans in rural and semi-urban areas.BMW Fin-Invest Private Limited Offer 5 Lacs to 25 Lacs Under Affordable Mortgage loan against property of Residential, Commercial, Industrial, Open Land to generate new business startup or business growth. Also will offer 10k to 5 Lacs under Micro small and medium enterprise loan where customer have business and want grow his business.

positions.subtitle: LimeTray
positions.description: Helped organization to build multiple products and moving from the monolithic architecture to microservices by ensuring DRY/High cohesion low coupling principles. Played every role from being a developer to a manager to a support guy whatever came in the way. Proposed and developed following frameworks/libraries-: 1. User Manager: It handles all the internal/external users and customers including their authorization and authentication across all the services and products. 2. Lt-Utils: Microservice utility framework built on top of Spring boot which doubled the productivity of developers and reduced the code of services up to 50% allowing the developer to concentrate on main business logic. (It had authorization, logger, request and user tracking. other utilities) 3. Lt-models: A library which centrally holds all the DTOs being used across the services and ensures DRY, code reusability principles. 4. Managed and developed many other services/products. 5. Technology Stack: Java, Python, MySQL, Cassandra, Spring boot, Kafka, Docker, Kubernetes, ActiveMQ.
positions.title: Senior Software Engineer
positions.description_html:
Helped organization to build multiple products and moving from the monolithic architecture to microservices by ensuring DRY/High cohesion low coupling principles.
Played every role from being a developer to a manager to a support guy whatever came in the way.

Proposed and developed following frameworks/libraries-:

1. User Manager: It handles all the internal/external users and customers including their authorization and authentication across all the services and products.

2. Lt-Utils: Microservice utility framework built on top of Spring boot which doubled the productivity of developers and reduced the code of services up to 50% allowing the developer to concentrate on main business logic. (It had authorization, logger, request and user tracking. other utilities)

3. Lt-models: A library which centrally holds all the DTOs being used across the services and ensures DRY, code reusability principles.

4. Managed and developed many other services/products.

5. Technology Stack: Java, Python, MySQL, Cassandra, Spring boot, Kafka, Docker, Kubernetes, ActiveMQ.
